revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=D-Link |model=DSL-2750B |revision=T1 |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=09/30/2011 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=SGE |manuf_model=Gan5.CT02W |manuf_rev= |availability=now |type=dsl modem,wireless router |fcc_id=KA2SL2750UT1 |us_id=3P7DL01BSL2750UT1 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM63281 |cpu1_cspeed= |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX25L12845EMI-10G |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Hynix |ram1_model=H5PS5162GFR-S5C |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0 |expansion_usb_num=1 |jtag= |serial=yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, (115200,8,N,1) |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM43225;BCM42335KMLG, HE1212 P20, 191469 3 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=4 |wan_ports= |addl_chips=DSL (ADSL2+) Line Driver;Broadcom;BCM6301;BROADCOM, 6301KSG, TD1122P1;1; |flags= |stock_boot=CFE;1.0.37-110.11; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.21.5;OpenRG; |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=bgn |default_ssid=28107bXXXXXX, b8a386XXXXXX, ccb255XXXXXX |default_ssid_regex=^28107b[a-f0-9]{6}$,,, ^b8a386[a-f0-9]{6}$,,, ^ccb255[a-f0-9]{6}$ |default_ip=192.168.1. |default_user=admin |default_pass=''randomly generated'' |oui=28:10:7B, B8:A3:86, CC:B2:55 |oui_eth=28:10:7B, B8:A3:86, CC:B2:55 }} {{TagLine|ADSL2 Modem Router}} :This modem has been used by '''{{Used by service|Verizon}}'''. "GAN5.CT02W-B_2T2R", "REV1.0", and "005SP0439640A" appears :to be silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. The default SSID pattern appears to be the MAC address :(no delimiters, lower case hex letters). ===Reviews=== *[https://www.insidegadgets.com/2015/03/24/inside-the-d-link-wireless-n300-adsl2-modem-router-dated-2012/ ''D-Link DSL-2750B'' on '''InsideGadgets'''] ===Serial=== ====Pinout==== The serial header is populated on this device - it is '''J6'''. 
J6
(RxD) (GND) (TxD) (3.3)
Pin4  Pin3  Pin2  Pin1
        |
        /\
to WI <    > to SoC
===General=== The username and password (at least @ stock) would appear to be identical :to the HTTP admin ones.. which are printed on the unit's label. The firmware used is presumably '''Jungo''''s '''''OpenRG''''', or a derivative. ===Derived info=== ====Boot log==== {{SCollapse|Boot log |
